Reviews.Title: “Subpar for Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: SomewhereinTX
Reviews.Content: We had problems checking in. The front desk clerk was not particularly helpful, or friendly. The issue was eventually resolved. Breakfast was worse than most Hyatt Place locations that we have stayed. Very little selection as far as breads/yogurt/etc. We enjoy that most Hyatt Place locations have Seattle's Best coffee. This one did not. Not a big deal, but it puts it below the other Hyatt Place locations. The coffee bar was open the evening we were there, but the cappuccino/espresso machine was broken. I have read that Hyatt Place is supposed to be/or has improved their breakfast. I hope this is the case. That would be great! All in all the hotel was fine. It was extraordinary. It wasn't terrible. You could likely find a hotel in this "slightly above average" range for less money in this area. If you find a good deal, it's hard to pass this one up!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly Average”
Reviews.Author: LydiaLLD
Reviews.Content: There were some definite positives to this hotel. The location is great, particularly if you're interested in shopping; the phenomenal Galleria is just a few blocks away. There are some good restaurants nearby along with plenty of "supplies" type of places like Wal-Mart within a few miles. It's easy on/off the major highways but there is a phenomenal amount of road construction going on all over Dallas, day and night. The hotel staff was nice and friendly. The room was very large with a sitting area/large sofa, work desk and wet bar with a small fridge. I enjoyed the massive television and watching a movie one night in HD was definitely a treat. It was relatively clean but the carpet was worn. The bed was nice and comfortable. On the negative side, the room lacked any drawer space. There were three very small drawers in the dressing area by the sink. One of them contained a hair dryer and bible so it basically left two small drawers. There weren't any luggage stands so I basically lived out of my suitcase which sat on the floor in the living room. The most notable drawback was the closet. It was the smallest closet I have ever seen in a room. My shoes (8.5) barely fit in the closet and rested against the rail for the sliding door. I found the wet bar leaked after the first few hours resulting in a soaked cabinet under the sink. They had maintenance come fairly quickly to fix it. Overall, room space was fantastic and would make for a great long-term business stay. The lack of space to unpack your suitcase was a huge negative for me. At a minimum, a luggage stand would have at least minimized the inconvenience a small bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great "corporate experience" hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpancakes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the good touches, for a lower price. Full breakfast. Nice linens. Good service. Fitness center and nice, big, outdoor pool. Each room is a mini-suite. It was great. Everything good you'd expect and nothing you wouldn't! I'm not big on corporate chain hotels, but as they go, this one wasn't bad. The only thing I've not been able to figure out is how to get airline miles for my stay here (which is one of the perks of the chain hotels), when I added the number to the reservation! Maybe it takes a while...

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cjsr
Reviews.Content: Our bus tour group was fortunate to have stayed at this hotel two nights. We were treated well and had nice, clean, spacious rooms. The breakfast bar was excellent also. Would stay there again and would recomment it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpectedly good find.”
Reviews.Author: donnafrob
Reviews.Content: Got a special rate so we gave it a try and glad we did. Nice room, comfortable lobby, free bkfst like at other family hotels but not on styrofoam with plastic utensils. Bar and friendly staff a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: MCMinor
Reviews.Content: Everytime I walked in the hotel I was immediately greeted by the staff in a very friendly manner. Rooms were very clean and there is a wonderful complimentary breakfast included in the rate. Great value! There is also complimentary wi-fi. THis is a great hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A touch overpriced but otherwise great!”
Reviews.Author: crowlem
Reviews.Content: It's nicely furnished, it's clean and the rooms are of a decent size, albeit a bit smaller than the pictures you can see here. One thing to note is that because of the age of the building, the a/c unit is bolted to the wall, rather than built into an overhead vent. This means that if you happen to be getting into that side of the bed, you might have considerably less space than you thought, although the units themselves are modern. They are quite noisy however, so you're unlikely to get a good nights sleep with them on. There are no in rooms safes despite several pieces of literature advertising them, but otherwise the room is warm, cozy and very fresh. If you're into your television, the screens in the room are HUGE even by American standards. The bathroom however isn't. It's very cramped, although the shower does get plenty hot enough. The lifts are slow as treacle and don't inspire you with the most confidence however this is neither here nor there. The pool is outside as advertised, we didn't use it but it looked clean and clear enough. The breakfast is adequate although lacking in cooked meats and cheeses. The selection was cereal, yogurt, fruit, toast, english muffins and donuts... oh and if you were lucky there were some croissants. While plenty more food was available at cost, we would have liked to see a little more here, cold cooked meats etc. The coffee bar was welcome but had no prices displayed although worked out to be well priced in the end. The car park is easy enough to get to from either direction. if you are coming off the highway, you'll see the hotel on the left, theres a U-turn spot a few yards up which is easily negotiable. There's also a gas station down the road although it's expensive. Location couldn't be better. All in all, we really liked this place, but we couldn't help feel it was just a touch more expensive than it should be given what was on offer. Staff were friendly at all times, really truly helpful. We will definitely consider it again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasDad1836
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Dallas for the Cotton Bowl and chose this hotel for its location and reasonable price. The staff were all courteous and friendly. Hotel quality was in line with other Hyatt Place hotels I've stayed in. We enjoyed the location - two big blocks north of the Galleria and even closer to numerous restaurants and stores. Bottom line: I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK place for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business and the overall experience was OK. This is a cheaper brand of Hyatt with fewer amenities. The rooms are very large with a separate sitting area and a nice tv. However, the bathrooms are very small (barely enough room to close the door). There is a very small bar to sit at with basic wine, beer, liquor but there is not really a bartender per se. There is a limited food menu which is sufficient for a day or two but could grow old quickly. It seems every employee here does a little bit of everything. . from making food, checking people in, grabbing drinks from the bar, etc. The gym is small but never seemed to be crowded. The pool area looks nice thought I did not take advantage of this. The small business center does the trick. One definite positive is the daily free breakfast, basic continental style but more than enough to start the day, good coffee, etc. There is not too much to do in the immediate area in terms of restaurants, bars, shopping though there is a mall less than a mile away and a free shuttle which will take you within a limited area (I think 5 miles) but stops running at 10PM.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average Extended Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyK300
Reviews.Content: Usually extended stay-type hotels lack not only amenities but ambience and coziness. This place is different. Prices are very reasonable and the ambience is just right. The lobby is small but has snacks and a bar with a limited but good selection. Breakfast is average fare but they will actually cook up breakfast specials for an additional charge, so having eggs and potatoes is not out of the question. The location is great, short distance to the Galleria and approximately 500 feet from the DelFrisco's steakhouse with its great steaks and seafood. It's also close to a gas station and a bank as well as the connection to DFW Airport making it that much better of a deal. They provide a shuttle service to local area hotspots and I was able to go to the Arlington Oktoberfest easily without having to drive my rental and worry about parking when I get there. The biggest plus is that the entire staff (without exception) was pleasant and eager to accommodate my needs making what I thought was going to be a ho-hum stay actually memorable. I highly recommend this hotel for an economical and pleasant stay in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: drkish
Reviews.Content: Great location! Free shuttle at our disposal. Had dinner at Oceanaire at the Galleria. Absolutely rocked. Beds great, the double room slept 3 women---the huge kitchen/dining/lounging area was perfect. Large sectional made another bed. Perfect. Will stay here again. I'm a huge fan!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and spacious”
Reviews.Author: hagrid59
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find anywhere cheap to stay in Dallas so settled for a chain that we felt reliable. Definitely the case with this one - everything the same as others we've stayed in. Clean and modern. More of a business based clientele but this didn't bother us. Close to the Galleria and certainly a good base for north Dallas

Reviews.Title: “My in-laws were impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotels.com for a good rate but had to pre-pay. I was a little worried about that but found the hotel clean, service friendly and beds comfy. In fact my husband told me he slept better in that bed than at home! We did originally book king beds but ended up with doubles, but that was because of the pre-booking. When I told my inlaws what I paid they were surprised at the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Basic yet Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkpuipui99
Reviews.Content: I actually spent way too much time searching for a hotel until I found this one. If you are concerned about its location, don't. There's no way you can visit any Texas town without a car rental anyways, and by car this hotel is only 20 minutes from downtown (if you use the toll road). It actually ended up being very central to everywhere I wanted to go, including the outlets and the famous King Sauna & Spa. All other hotels I searched either waaaaay overcharge, or have no free parking, or have no free internet. This Hyatt Place gives you free wifi internet, and plenty of free parking. The room was very big, with a wet bar and a sitting room. The fixtures are all top notch, the beds are comfortable, and it's got a small swimming pool (best suited for kids). This place is very efficient (read: minimal staff). There are check-in/check-out kiosks in the lobby for self-service, and most times of the day, the "gallery host" is an all-in-one staff responsible for food, drinks, front desk etc. Surprisingly, service was NOT compromised because of that. Staff were all beyond friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: john398
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern lobby, friendly staff who asked me if I prefer to be on lower floor ior upper floor, said Upper so was given 5th floor The only thing I wish the contenaental breakfast included meat and or eggs but they were available for an extra fee Just stayed 1 night which was fine for us as we do not live too far away but wanted a night out

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - convenient to Love Field”
Reviews.Author: BaseballFan5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, and it really stood out to me that the staff was very friendly. At breakfast, at least 4 employees said "hello" or "good morning" in a matter of 10 minutes. The kids love the TV. This is our second stay at a Hyatt Place (the other was in Austin a few days before) and we will use this chain again. The beds are doubles when there are 2 to a room, and I prefer queens with my flip floppy kids, but it wouldn't deter me from staying again. This location is very near Love Field - maybe about 10 minutes or so in normal traffic. Great rate - $109/night for 4 people on a Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Girls basketball team trip”
Reviews.Author: JohnslovelyladyJenn
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for the coach and the girls. One room smelled bad on day one. We spoke with the evening staff about the issue. The man was simply rude and not concerned about the problem. The lady had to come and find another room. That room was smelly also. We found the source of the problem which was the refrigerator, it smelled like fish. We asked them to remove it. The man came to the door and asked us do we still want the refrigerator moved. we said "yes" and he said "well unplug it and walked off." Then he can and removed it leaving us with no way to cool our items for the game. After the game we came back in and spoke to the lady at the front desk who informed us that they had not been able to locate another refrigerator and to check back. I can back and the unconcerned man was back at the counter. He told me that he did not know what I was talking about and that he could not help me. I would have to wait until maintenance can because they were the only ones who could change it out. The nice lady later came and gave us another one. Tonight there are a group of drunk people out here talking very loudly and saying racial comments and saying vulgar terms that should not be in a family orientated area. I don't know where the unfriendly front desk man was for that 30 mins but he can back and told the lady to get from behind the counter. And the drunk group when on there way. This has been the worst experience ever. There were two nice ladies. One in the Am and one in the PM but this is horrible even the pool is not some place you can let your kids swim in.

Reviews.Title: “Poor billing system”
Reviews.Author: MiraRaleigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a night only. That was a prepaid booking via priceline.Hotel took my credit card details and keep on charging my credit account unnecessarily and when I call them several times they promise to refund. That was very annoying and with an overseas credit card, need to pay a price for every transaction from my pocket for their mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjuliennow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days - had a king room - room was comfortable but a bit on the used side: knicks, scratches and dents in the walls and bathroom. Free wireless internet access was good. Breakfast was ok, good selection of healthy alternatives including oatmeal and fruit. Close to the Galleria shopping mall but didn't get much of a chance to get out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay and hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located approx. 1 mile from Galleria. The rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. The check-in personnel is very friendly. A simple continental breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location & Value !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mosk215
Reviews.Content: We took the family for a quick trip to Dallas so they can go to the American Girl store. This hotel was awesome - very clean - great location - great value. The room is very spacious - my wife and I shared the king bed while the two girls used the pull out queen sofa bed. The room has a nice desk with free wi-fi and a medium size refrigerater. We all enjoyed a very nice Free breakfast. The biggest compliment goes to the staff. They were all very helpful, cheerful, and willing to help with anything we needed. We can't wait to come back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: debrass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from his daughter's wedding in Dallas (Addison) Texas. We stayed at the Hyatt Place Dallas-North from Thursday to Monday. This hotel stay was quite pleasant. Matt at the front desk is very knowledgeable and helpful and gave us a limited tour of the hotel upon arrival. Only drawback was there was no hot-tub at the pool site. Pool is a little small but it was very clean and served its purpose. Also could have used a microwave in the room, but there is a small fridge. A standard continental breakfast is served each morning from 6 to 9:30, but, you are able to order a full breakfast, if you desire, from the breakfast Kiosk. We were able to print our boarding passes (free) in the business center, plus there is free wi-fi in your rooms. The hotel is centrally located to wonderful shopping and restaurants. Rooms are very clean, and, all toiletries are provided for you, including tooth paste and razors for shaving. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: crazymitian
Reviews.Content: I am extremely impressed with the Hyatt Place pricing and the quality of the hotels. I had to attend a training and this hotel was located pretty close to the training center and a huge Dallas mall. It is also very close to the restaurant street where you can get any cuisine you can imagine. With free breakfast and great pricing, I will definitely staying more at the Hyatt Place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ptreece1
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Lori, the sales Mgr. She was wonderful, gave our tour group a wonderful rate. Our rooms were fabulous, wonderful, helpful staff. I would recommend this hotel to any group or individuals looking for a hotel in the North Dallas area. Also, it is located acr from the Galleria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay...”
Reviews.Author: TrevorH2
Reviews.Content: This is a solid, clean and attractive hotel in a wonderful part of North Dallas. Extremely close the Galleria and not too far at all from the downtown Dallas attractions. I got an amazing deal on a King room paying only $55 a night for a weekend stay. Its was far less expensive and much larger and nicer than any room I've ever booked at that rate. The staff was friendly, the decor was stlyish and modern and it's very well located. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, contemporary style, and good location!”
Reviews.Author: Reddy45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weekend night as part of a trip to Arlington to visit some of the attractions. For the rate I was able to get, I am extremely satisfied with the stay. Here are the points I'd like to mention: 1. Good location. This area of Dallas is fairly upscale/modern with lots of shops and restaurants. There is a CVS across the street if you need anything. 2. Value. As a AAA member, I got a pretty good rate for a great room with a nice view. 3. Contemporary design. Nothing turns me away from hotels than "typical" furnishings and bland or overly bold colors. The rooms here are very upscale in appearance with marble countertops, modern faucets, LOTS of lighting, and a pretty nice couch. 4. Parking lot. You don't have to park very far from the main entrance and the lot is well lit and there are plenty of spaces available. 5. The WiFi/Wired internet in each room is pretty fast! You'll have no problem watching YouTube videos. There were some annoyances while I was there, but these are pretty minimal for the value I received. 1. Ice machines. For some reason the ice machines on the 5th and 6th floor were out. 2. Elevators. I know this building used to be a different hotel, so that would explain this part. Basically, the elevators are really slow. One of the elevators had a door that closed really slowly, too. 3. Bathroom. Boy was this small. Definitely a one person bathroom. 4. Breakfast. It isn't much. Cereal, juice, milk, coffee. No problem, though, because you can drive less than 5 minutes to find something else to eat. If you need to stay in north Dallas, I definitely recommend this place over the more expensive ones that will nickel and dime you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: faithful34
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend took the kids on a trip to Dallas. I would give this hotel a thumbs up. The hotel was very clean and neat; staff was friendly and courteous; rooms were clean and roomy; very comfortable beds. My and my kids stayed in a room together; we had a pull out sofa sleeper and two double beds (very roomy); ;my boyfriend had a king size bed with a sofa sleeper (very roomy). The only downside was that there was no microwaves in the room; you have to down stairs to the kitchen. No big breakfast, just a continental breakfast. But those are just minor things. A block from the Galleria mall and surrounding restaurants. I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business. Great price too?

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price. Its like a B&B at the price of a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: narulavishalhotmail
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place, North Dallas, for 3 weeks, on Business:- Booking of a Hyatt Hotel is convenient as Hyatt has a toll free local booking number for each country. The Hotel is well placed in North Dallas and is closed to many commercial places and malls. The Hotel has spacious rooms. There is a no smoking policy in the Hotel. Having said that the rooms still carry a very distinct smell of cigarettes. The hotel does not have room service. Hence, it becomes necessary to look for restaurants around. And restaurants around are typical Texas style. Hence you miss the multi cuisine luxury that is offered in other Hotels. There is no service at all. For any needs, such as housekeeping requirements, Laundry, one needs to go to the reception in person and collect what is required or give and collect laundry. The hotel claims to provide Buffet breakfast, but they have the same spread each day which consists of Baggels, Toast, Flakes, Milk / Coffee and fruits only. It can get pretty annoying for a long stay. The hotel claims to have a business center, but they have a computer with internet connection and printer near the reception. Nowhere close to t business center. The Hotel provides WiFi internet, however, there is no alternative if the Wireless is not working or if your laptop does not have a WiFi. The Fitness centre has a couple of Treadmills and a few instruments for basic workout. It is not a full fledged Fitness Centre. The swimming pool is out in the open, hence no swimming possible in winter. In short, It is like a self service hotel at the price of a Hyatt. Not highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “CONSISTENT PERFORMER”
Reviews.Author: gbking
Reviews.Content: Stayed at North Dallas Hyatt Place in March of 2010 with my wife. We were there for the wedding of an old friend's daughter in Farmers Branch. Hyatt Place provided solid value at a good price as usual. Love the flat screen TV and free Wi-Fi. Front desk help very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Unusual for hotels nowadays, plenty of light for reading in bed. Continental breakfast a bit light, but plenty of variety. All in all, lived up to usual expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: okc-florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights for a little mini vacation to go see The Phantom of the Opera. This place was very clean and that is extremely important to me. It was a great price for what we were looking for because it was at least 3 stars and in my price range. I researched the hotel on here first and that is why I picked it because of the good ratings. The only thing I would recommend is that they offer some of the hot breakfast items to be free along with the continental breakfast. With that nice of a hotel it was a little disappointing not to have at least scrambled eggs or waffles included. The staff was excellent and that sure does make things nicer. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Holiday in a very Friendly City”
Reviews.Author: 1968birchwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 7 nights and didn't really have any complaints other than we were suprised that there was no safe in the room. This would make things a lot easier for guests. The hotel as a whole is clean and tidy and the rooms are the same, as well as being very spacious. The hotel staff are friendly and happy to help with any query you may have. It was nice to have breakfast in the hotel before heading out for the day (as many hotels in America only offer "Room Only). We found the breakfast to be more than adequate as you can choose from fruit, cereals, yoghurts, bagels and toast every morning or order something hot (at an extra charge) The hotel offers a free shuttle for anyone wanting to travel within a 5 mile radius and we used this to get to the DART station every day. We found this to be a very convenient and economical way to travel as the trains arrive and depart every 20 minutes and we always got a seat on the train. The journey to Downtown Dallas takes around 35 minutes. There are plenty of eating place close by the hotel and shopping can be found in the Galleria. We ate at Del Frisco's which is just outside the hotel and although a little more expensive, we had a lovely meal. Another place we enjoyed was the Cafe Grand Lux in the Galleria, we ate there a couple of nights. While in Downtown Dallas we visited the Sixth Floor Museam, Holocaust Museam and the Aquarium. We enjoyed all of these attractions however it might be best to try and avoid the Aquarium on a day when there is school trips - can be busy!!! Outwith the centre of Dallas, we visited the Zoo which was really enjoyable and the Stockyards at Fort Worth ( we purchased a Regional Pass for $7.50 and this got us right to the Stockyards as you can travel on the DART, TRE and the local buses with your ticket). We also visited Southfork and toured the house etc which was fun. If you are looking to get to Southfork and you don't have a car (like us), you can get the DART to Parker Rd Station and then phone for a taxi which will take you there. The only down side was that we were glad that we had done our homework (some of the tips which I have added above) before we went, as the city itself isn't set up for tourists and the places of interest aren't really advertised. All in all we had a really great time and we discovered that the people in Dallas where some of the friendliest and most helpful people we had met on our travels. Dallas is worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jross310
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in January, great value. Close to a huge shopping mall across the street. Plenty of dinning options for every budget close by. Downtown is about 15 minutes away. The rooms are big, good tvs, small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: malujerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed nov 09 with my wife for a weekend. The place was clean and modern, food was good, and location is great because of the local malls and highways and only 1/2 hour from downtown with traffic! I've always like hampton inn better because of their breakfast but this place comes in at a close 2nd for the category of hotel class that it is in. My room was clean, big, comfy, big flat screen, free internet, couch, with prompt room service. The whole place had a really decent welcome feeling/vibe if you know what I mean. BTW, despite it being a cheaper hotel right next to expensive hotels, the other guests were not obnoxious & noisy, and etc. which is what I always worry about. The guests were all different family sizes, races, ages, etc, and all nice! But we did notice the next morning a car's back window was busted out. I have no idea if it was from theft or vandalism, but I'm guessing most likely someone must have left valuables in their car rather than random violence because the area does not seem like that.

Reviews.Title: “If you can avoid injury you will have a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Fresca99
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Hyatt Place Dallas North is its central location to many attractions, restaurants, shopping and major highways. The studio rooms are attractive and contain a separate living area with a large wrap around coach. One minor mishap occurred when my mother was taking the shuttle to the Galleria. The shuttle driver closed the door on her arm which scraped and bruised it up pretty badly. Thankfully, there was a CVS across the street where we bought some bandages and antibiotic ointment. The hotel filed an accident report but did nothing further to make restitution for my mother's injury. They did say that the van driver would be sent for further training. The hand towel bar in my bathroom fell off the wall and my mother's room was not cleaned until 4 p.m. in the afternoon. How I know this is that she was in the room reading when the maid entered the room to clean up. My room was not vacuumed well and we both had problems with our hotel bills at check out. The poor bookkeeper probably got fired.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: rabia3983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on July 18th - 19th 2009 and loved it. I along with my mother planned a last minute trip to Dallas to attend a exhibition. I booked my room by calling the hotel itself and got the same price all the other websites were offering; got one room with two double beds. We drove in from Houston around 3:30pm and checked in. The room was BIG, CLEAN and had everything needed. Bed and sofa were comfortable and clean. I really liked the bed area and desk being separated...I used my internet and was up late, while my mom was sleeping. Hotel is only two mins. away frm the Galleria Mall, which is where i went and did some shopping and had dinner. There was a group of families (for a Pakistani wedding) staying at the hotel as well so i made sure we got to the breakfast a little early. Breakfast was fresh and plenty :), getting to the buffet by 9am was a good decision because by 9:30am it was crowded. Over all i have no complains and will stay at another Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBob1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 8 to 12 July. Selected this property based on price, location, and Hyatt Gold status. Good location for meetings, shopping, and other events. It is a 40 minute drive from DFW Airport off of Interstate 635 E. Good location, if you know the Dallas area well. Might be tricky if Dallas is brand new to you. A few fast food restaurants in the immediate area. The Galleria Mall and Valley View Mall are a minutes away. With a few exceptions, recent renovations of lobby and my room on 6th floor were obvious. Room layout was very good. The bathtub and its fixtures had not been renovated. The linens and towels were nice. There were few issues about the cleanliness of my room's walls and doors. Only one of two elevators seemed to work at a time. The elevators were slow which was odd since there were only 6 or 7 floors. Staff made it a point to greet guests as they entered and exited lobby. Free WiFi in room. Very fast and stable. Free parking. No parking structure. It is just a simple uncovered lot surrounding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean rooms, a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The staff were really friendly and went out of their way to make me a cup of tea, and it's a very clean hotel, spotless, really. It has a newness to it, and they told us they renovated last year. Breakfast is the best included continental I've seen: fresh cut fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, english muffins, coffee, tea, and cereal. It's casual dining, and it's just right: not too formal or anything, but you can help yourself. The room is spotless and well organized: there's a living room area with comfortable sectional sofa (and it's a pull out bed, too), a giant flat screen tv, minibar, and the beds are comfortable. Plenty of soft and fluffy towels. The soap and shampoo products are nice, pleasant-smelling. No hand lotion, though, but the location is right next to the CVS so you can pick up whatever you need. The A/C is adjustable and comfortable (very important for hot Dallas weather). The bathroom is a kind of on the small side, but it's serviceable. We didn't use the pool, but we did use the exercise room, which is a row of exercise machines in good condition, outfitted with satellite tv, and they have headphones with disposable earcovers you can borrow. The lobby is pleasant enough, so we took a few photos there of us and some friends, while we hung out and talked. There's a kind of Starbuck's down at the reception desk so you can get a snack at all hours and something to drink, too. The small business center is adequate, fast internet. Parking and internet are free, which is great. And you get the USA Today. The location's terrific, near two big highways, Tollway and 635, and close to Addison, where you'll have lots of nice restaurants to pick from. And it's close to the Galleria mall, good shopping there.

Reviews.Title: “Look no more, this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue4
Reviews.Content: Staying here was a wonderful experience. We stayed 6 nights and the lg room was great for all our shopping bags!! Comfey beds, free WiFi, and free parking. Why can't the big boys offer this?? One block from Tollway so easy to get anywhere. Best of all was the staff. Everyone @ the front desk treated us like we were guests that frequented the Hyatt over & over again. No wonder, Christi, the Manager of H.P. has the same attitude. We will definitely stay there anytime we visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Why have I never found Hyatt Place's before? From the five star reception by the amazing staff to the spacious, modern rooms with huge flat screen TV's, this hotel is a real find. Apparently Hyatt started this concept about 4 years ago, and they've really come up with a winner. The rates are very reasonable and there's plenty of room for a family (or business traveler) to spread out. The lobby decor is modern and chic, and a continental breakfast is included in the rate. It was actually quite good, with fruit that is really fresh and a nice selection of cereals and breakfast beads, plus a menu is available for additional hot items. Lunch and dinner items are also on the menu, and while there isn't room service, you can order from menu 24 hours a day. The menu prices are incredibly reasonable and the food we had was excellent. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, having ordered pizza, grilled cheese (they use real cheddar!), and mac 'n cheese (this is not Kraft from a box!) for the kids. My older daughter and I also tried the spinich artichoke dip and it was excellent as well, although we wished the portion was a bit larger because it was so good. Every room at this hotel has a small refrigerator and the sofa, which makes out into a double bed, is large and comfortable, wrapping around the corner of the room. There's free wifi in the rooms, the towels are actually soft, and did I mention the 24 hour bar offering wine, beer, and Starbucks coffees, lattes, and cappuchinos? The pool was also nice. It is outdoor, but is heated and was already open in mid-March. The only drawback to the room was that the closet was tiny, but I would hang my clothes from the shower rod (which is curved, providing tons of room in the shower) to stay at this hotel. The other possible negative is that the vanity area, which has granite countertops like the wet bar area, is open to the sleeping area. My older daughter was trying to sleep in and the vanity light lit up the sleeping area, but again, that small minus is more than balanced by all the positives of this hotel. The coffee maker is also evidently designed for the business traveler as it is a one cup brewer, but there are 2 packets of coffee so that you can make 2 cups, and the coffee is Starbucks - best cup of coffee I've every brewed in a hotel room. They even have a shuttle over to the Galleria, or you can stroll over if the weather is nice - it's only 2 blocks. I will definitely stay here again, and will look for this chain in other cities. Kudos to Christie, the manager, who greeted us when we arrived and gave us a tour, explaining all the amenities. This gal should be teaching classes on customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Perfection of Service”
Reviews.Author: Fusion-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world. I would describe myself as a frequent traveler with over 200 nights a year away on business, and have found a secret in Dallas called the Hyatt Place. The hotel is immaculate; rooms are clean with flat panel TVâ€™s sofa and wifi. Breakfast is included along with the morning paper and Starbucks coffee. The availability of hot cookies and simple yet high quality food, tastes excellent. One can even enjoy a small but fine collection of wines and beer to drink along with a great smile and greeting after a long day. This hotel is lead by Ms. Kristi Christianson the most professional leader I have met at any corporation in years. She has brought together a cohesive team eager to engage the guest. It is probably her dedication and attention to detail that separates this hotel from others. Here is an example: if you stay at a 5 star property youâ€™re receiving services but everyone has a specific role. This means that any request will take time and calls etc. It feels like an inconvenience and task and I find myself just not even bothering. At the Hyatt Place on Spring Valley Rd in Dallas, you are always greeted by last name and your needs are anticipated! Should you request anything, from any team member, they have the ability and desire to execute with perfection. Yes this may seem strange, that I am speaking of a reasonably priced business hotel as if it were a 5 star resort. My only wish is that one could open the windows, which is a rarity in todayâ€™s hotels. Road warriors, families if youâ€™re in Dallas stay at the Hyatt Place on Spring Valley Rd, it is understated perfection. My many thanks to Ms. Christianson and her dedicated staff for their great care.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaeagan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standard Hyatt Place and everything was as expected (free continental breakfast, HDTV in room with nice couch and ottoman). Only complaint is I reserved king room and received 2 queens because they were out of kings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: miaNederland
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with the lobby - everytime we entered there were friendly staff greeting us ... what a nice touch. We checked in with no problem, and made our way through the nicely decorated lobby to our room (the lobby's intimate spaces make you feel comfortable - like you are in someone's home). The elevator was a little scary - you can tell it is the old elevator (they did try to update the look - but it still seems old). The elevator moans and groans as it travels to your floor. Our room was wonderful. It was very large .... it had a kitchen area with fridge, big comfy couch, HUGE TV, two queen beds. The previous reviews which mention the a/c are correct. The unit reminded me of the units in a Motel 6 - it was quite loud when running - but it wasn't really a problem for us. The bathroom is small, but there is a large area for dressing outside the bathroom. The vent fan in the bathroom was very loud, and it was annoying when running (which it does whenever the bathroom light is on). The noise drove my husband crazy. We were able to hook up a dvd player to the huge tv which the kids loved. Overall - this was a perfect room size and decor for my family (2 adults and 15Yr old and 10 Yr old). The only bad things to say were the a/c and vent fan - but those were minor issues. We did swim in the pool - it's nothing really special - just a pool. We did use the exercise room - very nice - tvs on exercise equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine with a few Gripes”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: We checked in for one night. Our main beef was with the air conditioning. In our room, it was a wall unit placed behind the beds against the outside wall. We had two queen beds in the bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room. I haven't seen one of these since I last stayed in a motel like LaQuinta. It definitely did not cool the room with the pull out bed where our grandson was sleeping. We did LOVE the large 42" plasma HDTV in the room. Best picture clarity of a hotel TV I've ever seen! Absolutely loved it. It swiveled around so that the living room and the bedroom could both see the picture. There was a very small bathroom, but we made do. The continental breakfast was very crowded, but we got our breakfast and were able to find a place to sit, and were on our way. Not the best, but not the worst either. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not bad... but a few gripes!”
Reviews.Author: PVPathfinder
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Everyone seemed pretty friendly. Made our reservation online about a month before our trip to Dallas, but they couldn't find us in the system when we showed up to check in. The gal at the counter discovered after a few tense moments that we were in "the other system". Not quite sure what that meant, but after driving for 9 hours, and being late for a wedding rehearsal, things weren't looking too good. She was able to find us on "the other system" after a few more minutes, and all was well. Room was nicer than expected and clean. 42 inch plasma TV was an unexpected perk. We were able to sneak in about an hour at the pool. Nothing fancy, but nice. Extra towels are located at the pool, so you don't have to bother with bringing any down from your room. So, plenty of hits! However, a few misses... Driving in Dallas is a rather odd experience, and you can only get in the hotel from one direction on the street, so keep your eyes peeled and be ready for a u-turn. The closet in our room was tiny. It was a small closet, with an even smaller door. We were able to squeeze in a few items, but not many. Another thing, couldn't get hot water in either sink. It was warm, but not hot (although the shower was fine). The "almost disaster" when we were checking in could have been really bad. If you book a room online, make sure to print out your confirm # and bring it with you. Didn't seem like the credit card used at time of booking was much help... Last but not least, I don't think the toilet was completely bolted down. It wobbled quite a bit when sitting down and getting up. Even noticed a wobble when I plopped my foot on it while drying off after a shower. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: SoDakMommy
Reviews.Content: My sister is a travel agent and she was able to get us a room for a discounted rate. I was excited for a new hotel that wouldn't feel tired... We got to the hotel about 5pm. The lobby was decorated with contempory accents, and the check in desk was very small and felt intimate. Our room was on the third floor, right near the elevator (I was surprised at how quiet it ended up being). The room has a living room area with a large L-shaped sofabed and a desk and wet-bar area with a small fridge. It could use a microwave also. The was a small wall dividing the living area from the sleeping area. The king size bed was VERY confortable, and the pillows were awesome. The bathroom was bathroom had a sink seperate from the toilet/shower room. There was an awesome HUGE flat screen HDTV that was between the two areas and swiveled back and forth. Downsides: the closet was very small, and there wasn't a dresser or a place to really set our suitcases, other than on the floor. There is a complimentary breakfast of toast/bagels/cereal/fruit available. Or you can order a more traditional hot egg breakfast for an additional charge I'd stay at this chain again

Reviews.Title: “New Life to Tired Property”
Reviews.Author: dr__dawggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now a part of the Hyatt chain and is receiving a much needed facelift. Rooms are fully renovated. Construction is still underway in the lobby area. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with large plasma tvs...new beds and linens paint and carpet. Breakfast was included in rate, with cereal, toast, pasteries and eggs...Staff was attentive and very helpful with suggestions for restaurants, navigating traffic and so forth. Booked via priceline for 60 a night...well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had NEVER stayed at any hotel as filthy as this one. As soon as we walked in the door, we noticed that the floor was dirty. Here's a tip, Amerisuites, if you're going to have a pop corn machine for your guests, please have someone clean up the mess left behind. I almost tripped on the thick layer of crushed pop corn stuck to the floor. Also, the breakfast area, which is right as one comes into the lobby, was still dirty from breakfast, even though it was 8pm! There were dirty napkins crumpled up on the tables and food crumbs everywhere. The room itself was NOTHING like the pictures posted online. For starters, the decor was old and dark, the stench of gym locker that emanated as soon as we opened the door was unbearable, the carpet was filthy with crumbs and it had stains EVERYWHERE. The room was very small, with the TV in the middle, so once in bed it was nearly impossible to see it. That is, if you can get into the rock-solid bed. The room is so small that one side of the bed is crammed up against the a/c unit. The bathroom walls were moldy, the floor was not clean, the toilet was stained, the towels felt like sandpaper and -here's the kicker- there were pubic hairs in our wash cloths! Even after all that, since we have two infants and didn't want to risk not finding alternate accommodations for the night (it was a holiday weekend), we decided to stay. Please, don't even think about having breakfast here! I know it's free, but please go to the Jack in the Box down the street and spare the $5. There were mold spots on the frozen French toasts that had been nuked solid, the once frozen waffles were still cold, the scrambled eggs were runny, the fruit had gone bad, and the boiled eggs were so hard they gave the term 'hard bolied eggs' a new meaning! They were like golf balls!! To top it off, the staff was rude and uncaring, and some didn't even speak English. PLEASE DON'T EVER STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for Families or Groups!”
Reviews.Author: free2bee
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a trip for my teenage Girl Scout troop year-end trip to RainForest cafe & the Grapevine Mills Mall. We wanted something with room and additional amenities. This was a perfect fit. Reservation: After checking this site & the hotel site, I called the hotel directly. The agent I spoke with was very friendly. I booked 2 rooms and requested that they be connecting. The advertised rate was $129 per night. He asked me if I was with a group and when I mentioned it was for Girl Scouts he gave me a reduced rate. We saved $15 on each room. Location: The hotel was very easy to find. It is located at the back of the mall next to several other hotels, including Hilton, Homewood Suites & Springhill Suites, which is currently being built. Parking was free & very plentiful. This hotel is very near the Dallas/Ft. Worth airport. Check in: Arrived at 10:30 AM and stopped to see if check-in was possible. Normal check-in hour is 3:00 PM. The front desk (Ms. Fuentes) was very helpful. I had requested connecting rooms. These were not available at this time, but I was told that if I could come back a little later they might could find some for us. They offered to store our luggage for us, but it wasn't necessary. After eating & spending some time shopping, we came back about 2:30. They had saved the connecting rooms for us. Rooms: The rooms we received were great. Each room contained 2 double beds, which were very firm & comfortable. These rooms are min-suites and have a living room separated by a partial wall. The living room contained a sleeper sofa & chair, 3 tables & 2 table lamps. I slept on the sleeper and it was ok, about normal as far as these go. Extra pillows, & bedding was stored in the closet area. There was also a desk with a chair & lamp. Also in the desk area, was a small kitchenette. This contained a small sink, small microwave, mini fridge, and even dishes & silverware. This was perfect for the snacks that we had brought with us. The bathroom was adequate with a toilet & bath/shower combo. A sink with plentiful space was just outside the bathroom door. Although near the airport, we never heard airplanes from inside the room. All was very quiet. Breakfast: Included in the price was a complimentary breakfast buffet. This had about anything you could want, including make-your-own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, cold cereal, pastries, fruit, milk, 2 juices & coffee. Even my picky girls could find plenty to eat. Social Hour: This hotel also had complentary social hour on Sun.-Thurs. We looked at it, but didn't stay. It seemed to included several snacks, as well as wine & beer. Pool: One great amenity was the pool. It was a nice size, ranging in depth from 3.5 - 5 ft. It was never crowded, so the girls swam both in the evening & the morning. The only bad element was the morning swim. When we went down to swim, the maintenance man had been called away & had left the cleaner in the pool. After waiting about an hour & checking with the front desk a couple of times, we were given permission to remove it. After this the girls had a great time. All in all we thought this was a great hotel and would gladly stay here again. For the location, price & amenities it can't be beat.
